articles.title: As AI nurses reshape hospital care, human nurses are pushing back
articles.author: David Snelling
articles.summary: Ana is an artificial intelligence program created by Hippocratic AI. She is available to chat 24-7, in multiple languages, from Hindi to Haitian Creole. It's the most visible sign of AI's inroads into health care, where hundreds of hospitals are using increasingly sophisticated computer programs to monitor patients' vital signs, flag emergency situations and trigger step-by-step action plans for care. Nurses' unions argue that AI is overriding nurses' expertise and degrading the quality of care patients receive.

articles.title: 47% of Large-Company Executives Comfortable with AI Agents Acting on Behalf of Customers
articles.author: Staff Report From Georgia CEO
articles.summary: NLX released the results of a survey of U.S. executives in companies with 5,000 or more employees on agentic AI. 47% of executives are comfortable having AI make decisions and complete tasks for their customers. Travel planning, grading papers, and applying for jobs were the tasks executives would be most comfortable with AI doing. Robotic process automation (RBA) and conversational experiences were nearly tied for the form of AI with the most potential to improve customer experiences and satisfaction. Autonomous backend systems were close behind.
